description: Expresses 'around' or 'about' a certain time or age
explanation:
### Name
- 〜ごろ（時間・年齢の目安）

### Meaning and function
- Marks an approximate point in time or age: around/about (time), roughly (age)

### Form and templates
- N(time/age) + ごろ
- N(time/age) + ごろ + に (optional “at”)
- N(time/age) + ごろ + から/まで/には/までに/は/も
- Question words + ごろ (e.g., いつごろ, 何時ごろ, 何歳ごろ)
- Predicate use: N(time/age) + ごろ + です/でした is possible
- Particle order: attach particles after ごろ (ごろに, ごろから, ごろまで, ごろには, ごろまでに)
- Target N(time/age): clock times, days/dates, months/years/seasons, parts of the day, holidays, ages

### Usage notes and constraints
- Register: neutral; natural in both speech and writing; very common at all politeness levels
- Semantics: indicates an approximate point in time (not a duration/length). Use for when something happens, not how long it lasts
- ごろ vs ぐらい:
  - ごろ: approximate point in time/age
  - ぐらい/くらい: approximate amount/degree/duration; can also mark approximate time, but use ごろ when you specifically mean “at around (time)”
- ごろ vs ころ:
  - ごろ attaches to time/age nouns (often with numerals/counters)
  - ころ attaches to clauses or broader time nouns/phrases to mean “around the time when …”
- Particle behavior: に after ごろ is optional; other particles also come after ごろ (not before)
- Combination range: ごろから〜ごろまで is fine to show an approximate span bounded by two approximate points
- Orthography:
  - Hiragana ごろ is standard and safest
  - Kanji 頃 appears in writing
  - ころ is a variant; with numerals/time words, ごろ is generally preferred
  - Fixed phrase このごろ/この頃 means “these days” (set expression; not the same as the suffix ごろ)

### Common mistakes (optional, only if relevant)
- Using ごろ with durations: × 三時間ごろ → use 〜時間ぐらい/くらい for durations
- Using ごろ with quantities/people: × 三人ごろ → use 〜人ぐらい/くらい
- Misplacing particles: × にごろ → correct order is ごろに
- Using ごろ after a clause: after verbs/clauses use ころ, not ごろ
- Redundant stacking of approximators (e.g., heavy use of だいたい + ごろ) can sound wordy

### Related grammar (optional, only if relevant)
- 〜ぐらい／〜くらい: approximate amount/degree/duration; can also approximate time but is broader than ごろ
- 〜ころ: “around the time when …”; attaches to clauses or general time phrases (e.g., 学生のころ)
- N + 前後: “around/approximately” with numbers or times; more formal/written than ごろ

examples.jp: 何時ごろに到着しますか。
examples.en: About what time will you arrive?

examples.jp: 九時ごろから会議を始めます。
examples.en: We'll start the meeting around nine o'clock.

examples.jp: 午後三時頃まで外出していました。
examples.en: I was out until about 3 p.m.

examples.jp: 十歳ごろは背が急に伸びた。
examples.en: Around age ten, I suddenly grew taller.

examples.jp: いつごろ帰ってこられますか。
examples.en: About when will you be able to come back?

examples.jp: 春ごろには花がいっせいに咲きます。
examples.en: Around spring, flowers all bloom at once.

examples.jp: 1980年ごろにこの町で生まれました。
examples.en: I was born in this town around 1980.

examples.jp: 正午ごろは食堂があまり混みません。
examples.en: Around noon, the cafeteria is not very crowded.

examples.jp: 夕方ごろ、少し散歩しませんか。
examples.en: Around evening, shall we take a short walk?

examples.jp: 何歳ごろから英語を勉強しはじめましたか。
examples.en: From about what age did you start studying English?

examples.jp: 九時ごろには出ないつもりです。
examples.en: I don't plan to go out around nine.

examples.jp: 七時ごろに開く店は少ない。
examples.en: There are few stores that open around seven.

examples.jp: 九月ころに転職した。
examples.en: I changed jobs around September.

examples.jp: 週末ごろまでに返事をください。
examples.en: Please reply by around the weekend.

examples.jp: 夏休みごろもアルバイトを続けます。
examples.en: I will keep my part-time job even around summer break.

examples.jp: 面接は火曜日ごろではありません。
examples.en: The interview is not around Tuesday.

examples.jp: ピークは年末ごろでした。
examples.en: The peak was around the end of the year.

examples.jp: 明け方ごろは冷え込みが強くなる。
examples.en: Around dawn, the chill gets stronger.

examples.jp: 三十歳ごろに一人暮らしを始めた。
examples.en: I started living alone around age thirty.

examples.jp: 九時ごろから十一時ごろまで勉強していました。
examples.en: I was studying from around nine to around eleven.

negativeExamples.jp: 三時くらいに着きます。
このごろ、早起きがつらいです。
negativeExamples.en: These days, getting up early is tough.

negativeExamples.jp: 雨がやんだころ、外に出た。
negativeExamples.en: When the rain let up, I went outside.

negativeExamples.jp: 子どもの頃によく川で遊んだ。
negativeExamples.en: When I was a child, I often played by the river.

negativeExamples.jp: 七時前後に会いましょう。
昼くらいなら空いています。
negativeExamples.en: If it's around noon, I'm free.

negativeExamples.jp: カミナリがごろごろ鳴っている。
休日は家でごろごろしたい。
negativeExamples.en: On my days off I want to laze around at home.

negativeExamples.jp: 寝るころには雨も弱まっていた。
negativeExamples.en: By the time I went to bed, the rain had weakened.

negativeExamples.jp: 若い頃は夜更かしばかりしていた。
negativeExamples.en: When I was young, I stayed up late all the time.
